nodes.documentation: @dev The Market contract exchanges Dai for yDai at a price defined by a specific formula.
nodes.name: Market

nodes.documentation:
@dev Mint liquidity tokens in exchange for adding chai and yDai
 The parameter passed is the amount of `chai` being invested, an appropriate amount of `yDai` to be invested alongside will be calculated and taken by this function from the caller.
nodes.name: mint

nodes.documentation: @dev Burn liquidity tokens in exchange for chai and yDai
nodes.name: burn

nodes.documentation: @dev For the balance passed as an argument, returns the size of the reciprocal balance
nodes.name: targetYDaiBalance

nodes.documentation: @dev For the balance passed as an argument, returns the size of the reciprocal balance
nodes.name: targetChaiBalance

nodes.documentation: @dev The Market contract exchanges Dai for yDai at a price defined by a specific formula.
nodes.name: Market

nodes.documentation:
@dev Mint liquidity tokens in exchange for adding chai and yDai
 The parameter passed is the amount of `chai` being invested, an appropriate amount of `yDai` to be invested alongside will be calculated and taken by this function from the caller.
nodes.name: mint

nodes.documentation: @dev Burn liquidity tokens in exchange for chai and yDai
nodes.name: burn

nodes.documentation: @dev For the balance passed as an argument, returns the size of the reciprocal balance
nodes.name: targetYDaiBalance

nodes.documentation: @dev For the balance passed as an argument, returns the size of the reciprocal balance
nodes.name: targetChaiBalance

devdoc.details: The Market contract exchanges Dai for yDai at a price defined by a specific formula.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

burn(uint256).details: Burn liquidity tokens in exchange for chai and yDai

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

mint(uint256).details: Mint liquidity tokens in exchange for adding chai and yDai The parameter passed is the amount of `chai` being invested, an appropriate amount of `yDai` to be invested alongside will be calculated and taken by this function from the caller.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

targetChaiBalance(uint256).details: For the balance passed as an argument, returns the size of the reciprocal balance

targetYDaiBalance(uint256).details: For the balance passed as an argument, returns the size of the reciprocal balance

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.
